newsitem.title: MEXICO: Poll puts Mexico's PRI ahead in Sonora state.
newsitem.headline: Poll puts Mexico's PRI ahead in Sonora state.

text.p: Mexico's ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) leads the race for governor in the northern border state of Sonora ahead of July 6 elections, according to a poll released on Thursday.

The poll, conducted by the Centre for Opinion Studies at the University of Guadalajara, showed the PRI with the support of 40.6 percent of those polled compared to 28.1 percent for the conservative National Action Party (PAN).
The centre-left Party of the Democratic Revolution (PRD) was third with 14.1 percent.
The survey was conducted May 24-26, polling 2,541 people in 164 places in Sonora, with a margin of error of 1.94 percent, the centre said.
Mexicans on July 6 will elect six state governors, the mayor of Mexico City, all 500 members of the Chamber of Deputies (lower house) and one-fourth of the Senate.
